intro: Hemimeris sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Hemimeris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often with a slightly wavy margin. Hemimeris sinuata is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
